poem:
Title: "In the Halls of Highest Chambers"

In the vast marble maze of law,
Court papers rustling like autumn leaves.
The insurrection clause silent, in respectful pause,
Swift gavel falls, a nation breathes.
From Colorado's mountaintop to federal flaw,
Gears of justice turn, in unseen sleeves.
A dance of contention, sharp eagle's claw,
Yet, the morning light of democracy never deceives.
